summary: The document is a confidential communication from 11 October 1964, detailing intelligence matters concerning Cuba during the Cold War. It was declassified under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. The text covers the 'JAGUAR GROUP's dissatisfaction with communism leading to their intention to leave Cuba, operational insights into Cuban and Soviet military activities, including the arrival of a Russian ship with chemical fertilizer, an assassination attempt on Fidel Castro, and the defection of Cuban military personnel to the U.S., highlighting internal dissent.
key_findings: Individuals associated with the 'JAGUAR GROUP' sought to leave Cuba due to dissatisfaction with the communist regime's longevity and hardships.
Operational details of Cuban and Soviet military activities are discussed, including the entry of a Russian ship carrying chemical fertilizer.
An assassination attempt against Fidel Castro and its aftermath are detailed.
Reports of Cuban military personnel defecting to the U.S. indicate internal dissent within the Cuban military.
keywords: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
